snippet: California voters in 2008 approved a measure requiring more generous living conditions for hens, but the state’s decision to require imported eggs to be produced under the same standards has drawn a lawsuit.
abstract: California voters in 2008 approved measure requiring more generous living conditions for hens, but state’s decision to require imported eggs to be produced under the same standards draws interstate commerce lawsuit from Missouri; at least three other states are considering suits, and beef and pork lobbies are opposing California rules to prevent new restrictions on raising livestock.
lead_paragraph: California voters in 2008 approved a measure requiring more generous living conditions for hens, but the state’s decision to require imported eggs to be produced under the same standards has drawn a lawsuit.

headline.main: Wishing They All Could Be California Hens
headline.print_headline: They’re Going to Wish They All Could Be California Hens
